## **Getting Started**

## Loading R packages

```{r}
pacman::p_load(tidyverse, ggstatsplot) 
```

# Importing the data

```{r}
exam <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")
```

```{r}
set.seed(1234)

p <- gghistostats(
  data = exam,
  x = ENGLISH,
  type = "bayes",
  test.value = 60,
  bin.args = list(color = "black",
                  fill = "grey50",
                  alpha = 0.7),
  normal.curve = TRUE,
  normal.curve.args = list(linewidth = 0.5),
  xlab = "English scores"
)

p
```

```{r}
extract_stats(p)
```

```{r}
ggdotplotstats(
  data = exam,
  x = ENGLISH,
  y = CLASS,
  title = "",
  xlab = ""
)
```


```{r}
exam_long <- exam %>%
  pivot_longer(
    cols = ENGLISH:SCIENCE,
    names_to = "SUBJECT",
    values_to = "SCORES") %>%
  filter(CLASS == "3A")
```

```{r}
ggwithinstats(
  data = filter(exam_long,
                SUBJECT %in%
                  c("MATHS", "SCIENCE")),
  x = SUBJECT,
  y = SCORES,
  type = "p"
)
```

```{r}
ggscatterstats(
  data = exam,
  x = MATHS,
  y = ENGLISH,
  marginal = TRUE,
  label.var = ID,
  label.expression = ENGLISH > 90 & MATHS > 90
)
```
